text: before joining aws i work for almost 10
years as an i.t transformation manager
working on massive migration programs i
was very impressed by the proserv
consultant that i've met as a client on
my first cloud project his skills was
broad and his approach was very
different from what i was used to he was
flexible passionate and focused on
helping his customers
i remember when i first took the wall at
aws being questioned by a friend family
and ex-colleague about that choice why
would i leave my secure job to have a
techie role on a not yet mature
technology that is hardly adopted by a
large enterprise
nobody really understood me but i was
convinced that the cloud was a solution
to solve some of the recurring
challenges that i had observed in iit
enterprise infrastructure like reduction
of time to market and accelerating
innovation
today i'm a customer delivery architect
on the professional service team
and
my role is to work background from the
customer need to define both the
technical and the delivery solution the
most exciting part of my job is the
variety of topics that
i have to address
and i'm really have no routine and that
works for me
the pace of innovation at aws is so fast
that you need to be always adaptable and
agile and there is so much to learn but
the culture of sharing knowledge mean
that you always have the tool that you
need to succeed
i'm so glad that i took a chance to
follow my instinct and take a bet on the
cloud
today i still think back of the first
interaction that i had with this aws
employee
i had the chance to meet an inspiring
leader that helped me to understand the
potential of the cloud technology and
the importance of the amazon culture
now i hope i am the leader who will be
able to pay this knowledge forward to
the next generation of amazonia
